intro: Minquartia punctata, commonly known as the African star jelly or African starfruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash, and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruits are typically round or oval, with a rough, bumpy surface and a yellow or orange color when mature. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its unique appearance and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
